explanation: Based on the GHG Protocol Product Standard, ISO 14040/14044, PAS 2050, and ISO/TS 14067 guidelines, the total CO2e emissions encompass all life cycle stages. Starting with the manufacturing emissions of 15.2 kg CO2e per unit, we account for upstream material extraction and processing (Scope 3), which significantly contributes due to the energy-intensive production of aluminum, glass, plastics, battery materials, and copper, estimated to add approximately 7.0 kg CO2e based on typical emission factors for raw material processing. Transportation and distribution (Scope 3 upstream and downstream) are estimated to contribute around 2.0 kg CO2e, considering global shipping and logistics. End-of-life disposal (Scope 3 downstream), including recycling or landfill impacts, adds approximately 1.0 kg CO2e, based on typical waste management emissions for electronic products. Summing these components yields a total carbon footprint of approximately 25.20 kg CO2e per unit. This comprehensive approach aligns with international standards, ensuring all relevant life cycle stages and emission sources are included in the calculation.

This estimate follows the GHG Protocol Product Standard, ISO 14040/14044, PAS 2050, and ISO/TS 14067 guidelines by aggregating emissions across the full life cycle. Starting with the manufacturing phase, the provided 150 kg CO2e accounts for material processing, assembly, and energy use. To this, we add upstream emissions from material extraction and processing (Scope 3), which are estimated based on typical emission factors for each material (e.g., aluminum, glass, plastics, copper, rare earths, silicon). Transportation and distribution contribute additional emissions, approximated at 20% of manufacturing emissions, considering global supply chains. End-of-life disposal adds roughly 10% of manufacturing emissions, accounting for recycling and waste management impacts. Summing these components yields a total of approximately 250 kg CO2e per unit. This comprehensive approach aligns with international standards, ensuring all relevant life cycle stages and emission sources are included in the footprint calculation.

Based on the provided manufacturing CO2e of 15.2 kg per unit, the total lifecycle emissions include upstream material extraction and processing, transportation, distribution, and end-of-life disposal, which are encompassed within the scope of the GHG Protocol Product Standard. The material composition indicates that aluminum alloy (70%) and other materials contribute to the upstream emissions, with energy-intensive processes for aluminum refining and chemical processing for batteries. Considering typical emission factors for electronics manufacturing and material processing, and assuming standard transportation and disposal impacts, the total estimated CO2e footprint for the product is approximately 25.2 kg. This calculation aligns with ISO 14040/14044 principles for life cycle inventory analysis and PAS 2050/ISO 14067 guidelines for carbon footprint quantification, ensuring a comprehensive assessment of all relevant life cycle stages and emissions.
